There is an NWA workshop in Helsinki these days, as far as I 
understand the feedback I get from Finland it has been decided that 
NWA will develop tools to interface with the ARC format.
They seem to be considering two tools:
- An ARC retriever, that enables NWA to access an ARC archive
- An ARC exporter that exports data to an ARC based archive (in 
practise probably NEDLIB to ARC)

Prelimenary work on these tools has already started in Denmark.
We will post more information here once we have a stable (tested) 
version.

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Andrew Boyko" <aboy@l...> 
wrote:
> I'm going to give it a shot in the near future (before Feb 11) * 
just the brute-force approach of rewriting ARCs in the NEDLIB form.  
In the immediate term I'm a little hampered by the rather severe 
memory requirements of the NWA exporter (it croaks, out of memory, on 
what I'd call medium-sized input sets) but I should have my 
environment ironed out soon.
>  
> Andy Boyko    aboy@l...
> 
> 
> >>> gojomo@a... 1/27/2004 6:42:39 PM >>>
> 
> Has anyone begun work on tools to make an ARC-based dataset 
available
> through the NWA Access Toolset (http://nwa.nb.no/) -- either by 
coercing
> the ARC data into a Nedlib format or making a ARC-aware 
retriever/exporter?
> 
> Please keep us at the IA apprised of any progress, or any way we 
could
> help with code or testing.
> 
> - Gordon @ Internet Archive
